intro: Nicoraella rigidiseta, commonly known as the rigid-hairy nicoraella, is a flowering plant native to specific regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and lobed leaves, which help it adapt to its native environment. Its flowers are typically pink or purple, with five petals and stamens that are arranged in a showy pattern. Nicoraella rigidiseta is often found in moist, well-drained soils in forested areas.
